intro: Rhododendron saravanense, commonly known as the Saravan rhododendron, is a species native to the mountainous regions of eastern Iran. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, humid climates. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to red, bloom in late spring to early summer. Rhododendron saravanense is valued for its ornamental qualities and plays a role in the local biodiversity of its native habitat.
